intro: Spergularia diandra subsp. campestris, commonly known as the field sandwort, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pink to white flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal dunes or disturbed areas. This subspecies is adapted to harsh environments and is relatively drought-tolerant.
